title: The Believer the Object of Divine Love
poem:
Pause, my soul, adore and wonder,
Ask, Oh, why such love to me?
Grace hath put me in the number
Of the Saviour's family:
Hallelujah!
Thanks, eternal thanks to thee.
bible_verse: In this was manifested the love of God toward us, because that God sent his only begotten Son into the world, that we might live through him.

title: Redeemed by the Blood of Christ
poem:
Our sins and griefs on him were laid;
He meekly bore the mighty load:
Our ransom price he fully paid,
By offering up himself to God.
bible_verse: Forasmuch as ye know that ye were not redeemed with corruptible things, as silver and gold—but with the precious blood of Christ, as of a lamb without blemish and without spot.

title: Renewed by the Holy Ghost
poem:
Vain is every outward rite,
Unless thy grace be given:
Nothing but thy life and light,
Can form a soul for heaven.
bible_verse: Not by works of righteousness which we have done, but according to his mercy he saved us, by the washing of regeneration, and renewing of the Holy Ghost.

title: Partaker of the Divine Nature
bible_verse: Whereby are given unto us exceeding great and precious promises: that by these ye might be partakers of the divine nature, having escaped the corruption that is in the world through lust.

title: Justified Before God Through Christ
poem:
Jesus, thy blood and righteousness
My beauty are, and glorious dress;
'Midst flaming worlds, in these array'd,
With joy shall I lift up my head.
bible_verse: By him all that believe are justified from all things, from which ye could not be justified by the law of Moses.

title: United to Christ
poem:
Lord of the vineyard, we adore
That power and grace divine,
Which plants our wild, our barren souls,
In Christ the living Vine.

For ever there may I abide,
And from that vital root,
Be influence spread through every branch,
To form and feed the fruit.
bible_verse: I am the vine, ye are the branches: he that abideth in me, and I in him, the same bringeth forth much fruit: for without me ye can do nothing.

title: Joint-Heir with Christ
bible_verse: If children, then heirs; heirs of God, and joint-heirs with Christ.

title: Complete in Christ
poem:
Thy saints on earth, and those above,
Here join in sweet accord:
One body all in mutual love,
And thou their common Lord.
Yes, thou that body wilt present
Before thy Father's face,
Nor shall a wrinkle or a spot
Its beauteous form disgrace.
bible_verse: For in him dwelleth all the fulness of the Godhead bodily. And ye are complete in him.

title: Christ the Believer's Advocate
poem:
Look up, my soul, with cheerful eye,
See where the great Redeemer stands—
Thy glorious Advocate on high,
With precious incense in his hands.

He sweetens every humble groan,
He recommends each broken prayer;
Recline thy hope on him alone,
Whose power and love forbid despair.
bible_verse: If any man sin, we have an advocate with the Father, Jesus Christ the righteous.

title: Christ the Hope of the Believer
poem:
Jesus, my Lord, I look to thee:
Where else can helpless sinners go?
Thy boundless love shall set me free
From all my wretchedness and woe.
bible_verse: Paul an apostle of Jesus Christ by the commandment of God our Saviour, and Lord Jesus Christ, which is our hope.

title: Christ the Life of the Believer
poem:
If my immortal Saviour lives,
Then my eternal life is sure;
His word a firm foundation gives,
Here let me build, and rest secure.

Here, O my soul, thy trust repose;
If Jesus is for ever mine,
Not death itself, that last of foes,
Shall break a union so divine.
bible_verse: When Christ, who is our life, shall appear, then shall ye also appear with him in glory.

title: Christ the Peace of the Believer
poem:
"He is our peace"—for by his blood
Sinners are reconciled to God;
Sweet harmony is now restored,
And man beloved, and God adored.
bible_verse: Now in Christ Jesus ye who sometime were far off are made nigh by the blood of Christ. For he is our peace.

title: Christ the Righteousness of the Believer
bible_verse: This is his name whereby he shall be called, The Lord our righteousness.

title: The Temple of the Spirit
poem:
Creator Spirit! by whose aid
The world's foundations first were laid,
Come, visit every humble mind:
Come, pour thy joys on human kind:
From sin and sorrow set us free,
And make us temples worthy thee.
bible_verse: Know ye not that your body is the temple of the Holy Ghost which is in you, which ye have of God.

title: Sanctified by the Spirit
poem:
Come, Holy Spirit, love divine,
Thy cleansing power impart;
Each erring thought and wish refine
That wanders near my heart.
bible_verse: God hath from the beginning chosen you to salvation through sanctification of the Spirit and belief of the truth.

title: Upheld by the Spirit
poem:
Assisted by his grace,
We still pursue our way;
And hope at last to reach the prize,
Secure in endless day.
bible_verse: That he would grant you, according to the riches of his glory, to be strengthened with might by his Spirit in the inner man.

title: The Spirit of Adoption Received
poem:
Assure my conscience of her part
In the Redeemer's blood,
And bear thy witness in my heart
That I am born of God.
bible_verse: Ye have not received the spirit of bondage again to fear; but ye have received the Spirit of adoption, whereby we cry, Abba, Father.

title: Comforted by the Spirit
poem:
In the hour of my distress,
When temptations me oppress,
And when I my sins confess—
Sweet Spirit, comfort me.
bible_verse: When the Comforter is come, whom I will send unto you from the Father, even the Spirit of truth, which proceedeth from the Father, he shall testify of me.

title: Sealed by the Spirit
poem:
Forbid it, Lord, that we
Who from thy hands receive
The Spirit's power to make us free,
Should e'er that Spirit grieve.

O keep our faith alive,
Help us to watch and pray;
Lest, by our carelessness, we drive
The sacred Guest away.
bible_verse: Grieve not the holy Spirit of God, whereby ye are sealed unto the day of redemption.

title: Taught by the Spirit
poem:
Thine inward teachings make me know
The mysteries of redeeming love,
The emptiness of things below,
And excellence of things above.
bible_verse: When he, the Spirit of truth, is come, he will guide you into all truth: for he shall not speak of himself; but whatsoever he shall hear, that shall he speak: and he will show you things to come.

title: Fellow-Citizen with the Saints
poem:
The kindred links of life are bright,
Yet not so bright as those
In which Christ's favoured friends unite,
And each on each repose:
Where all the hearts in union cling,
With Him, the centre and the spring.
bible_verse: Now therefore ye are no more strangers and foreigners, but fellow-citizens with the saints, and the household of God.

title: Lives a Life of Faith in Christ
poem:
Close to the ignominious tree,
Jesus, my humbled soul would cleave;
Despised and crucified with thee,
With Christ resolved to die and live:
There would I bow my suppliant knee,
And own no other Lord but thee.
bible_verse: I am crucified with Christ: nevertheless I live; yet not I, but Christ liveth in me: and the life which I now live in the flesh I live by the faith of the Son of God.

title: Lives a Life of Consecration to God
poem:
Thine, wholly thine, I want to be;
The sacrifice receive:
Made, and preserved, and saved by thee,
To thee myself I give.
bible_verse: I beseech you therefore, brethren, but the mercies of God, that ye present your bodies a living sacrifice, holy, acceptable unto God, which is your reasonable service.

title: Lives a Life of Hope
bible_verse: Looking for the mercy of our Lord Jesus Christ unto eternal life.

title: Delivered from Condemnation
bible_verse: There is now no condemnation to them which are in Christ Jesus, who walk not after the flesh, but after the Spirit.

title: Delivered from the Power of Satan
poem:
Dry up your tears, ye saints, and tell
How high your great Deliverer reigns;
Sing, how he spoiled the host of hell,
And led the tyrant Death in chains.
bible_verse: Forasmuch then as the children are partakers of flesh and blood, he also himself likewise took part of the same; that through death he might destroy him that had the power of death, that is, the devil.

title: Delivered from All Iniquity
poem:
Fixed on this ground will I remain,
Though my heart fail, and flesh decay;
This anchor shall my soul sustain,
When earth's foundations melt away:
Mercy's full power I then shall prove,
Loved with an everlasting love.
bible_verse: Let Israel hope in the Lord: for with the Lord there is mercy, and with him is plenteous redemption. And he shall redeem Israel from all his iniquities.

title: Delivered from All Enemies
poem:
Foes are round us, but we stand
On the borders of our land:
Jesus, God's exalted Son,
Bids us undismayed go on:
Onward then we gladly press
Through this earthly wilderness.
bible_verse: He delivereth me from mine enemies; yea, thou liftest me above those that rise up against me.

title: Enjoys a Present Salvation
poem:
Filled with holy emulation
Let us vie with those above;
Sweet the theme—a free salvation,
Fruit of everlasting love.
bible_verse: Which in time past were not a people, but are now the people of God: which had not obtained mercy, but now have obtained mercy.

title: Preserved unto Eternal Salvation
poem:
Saints by the power of God are kept
Till full salvation come;
We walk by faith as strangers here
Till Christ shall call us home.
bible_verse: Who are kept by the power of God through faith unto salvation ready to be revealed in the last time.

title: A Pilgrim to a Heavenly Country
poem:
'Tis true, we are but strangers
And sojourners below;
And countless snares and dangers
Surround the path we go;
Though painful and distressing,
Yet there's a rest above,
And onward we are pressing
To reach that land of love.
bible_verse: Now they desire a better country, that is, an heavenly: wherefore God is not ashamed to be called their God: for he hath prepared for them a city.

title: Supreme Love to God
poem:
Yes, I would love thee, blessed God!
Paternal goodness marks thy name;
Thy praises, through thy high abode,
The heavenly hosts with joy proclaim.
bible_verse: Master, what shall I do to inherit eternal life? And he answering said, Thou shalt love the Lord thy God with all thy heart, and with all thy soul, and with all thy strength, and with all thy mind.

title: Gratitude to God
poem:
What thanks I owe thee, and what love,
A boundless, endless store,
Shall echo through the realms above,
When time shall be no more.
bible_verse: And one of them, [the ten lepers,] when he saw that he was healed, turned back, and with a loud voice glorified God.

title: Obedience to God
poem:
Love is the fountain whence
All true obedience flows;
The Christian serves the God he loves,
And loves the God he knows.
bible_verse: Ye were the servants of sin, but ye have obeyed from the heart that form of doctrine which was delivered you. Being then made free from sin, ye became the servants of righteousness.

title: Submission to God
poem:
Oh let my trembling soul be still,
While darkness veils this mortal eye,
And wait thy wise, thy holy will
Wrapped yet in tears and mystery:
I cannot, Lord, thy purpose see,
Yet all is well—since ruled by thee.
bible_verse: We have had fathers of our flesh which corrected us, and we gave them reverence: shall we not much rather be in subjection unto the Father of spirits, and live?

title: Faith in Christ
poem:
Lord, I believe thy heavenly word:
Fain would I have my soul renewed;
I mourn for sin, and trust the Lord
To have it pardoned and subdued.

Oh may thy grace its power display,
Let guilt and death no longer reign;
Save me in thine appointed way,
Nor let my humble faith be vain.
bible_verse: Whosoever believeth that Jesus is the Christ is born of God.

title: Love to Christ
poem:
Whom have I on earth below?
Thee, and only thee, I know:
Whom have I in heaven but thee?
Thou art all in all to me.
bible_verse: He that loveth father or mother more than me is not worthy of me: and he that loveth son or daughter more than me is not worthy of me.

title: Self-Denial for Christ
poem:
Take up thy cross, let not its weight
Fill thy weak spirit with alarm,
My strength shall bear thy spirit up,
And brace thy heart, and nerve thy arm.

Take up thy cross, and follow me,
Nor think till death to lay it down;
For only he who bears the cross
May hope to wear the glorious crown.
bible_verse: If any man will come after me, let him deny himself, and take up his cross daily, and follow me.

title: Confession of Christ
poem:
I'll tell to all poor sinners round,
What a dear Saviour I have found;
I'll point to his redeeming blood,
And say, "Behold the way to God!"
bible_verse: Whosoever shall confess that Jesus is the Son of God, God dwelleth in him, and he in God.

title: Devotedness to Christ
poem:
My soul, and all its powers,
Thine, wholly thine, shall be;
All, all my happy hours
I consecrate to thee:
Whate'er I have, whate'er I am,
Shall magnify my Saviour's name.
bible_verse: For whether we live, we live unto the Lord; and whether we die, we die unto the Lord: whether we live therefore, or die, we are the Lord's.

title: Imitation of Christ
poem:
Thy fair example may I trace,
To teach me what I ought to be:
Make me, by thy transforming grace,
My Saviour, daily more like thee.
bible_verse: For I have given you an example, that ye should do as I have done to you.

title: Christ is Precious
poem:
Jesus, in thy transporting name
What glories meet our eyes!
Thou art the angels' sweetest theme,
The wonder of the skies.

Oh may our willing hearts confess
Thy sweet, thy gentle sway;
Glad captives of thy matchless grace,
Thy righteous rule obey.
bible_verse: Behold, I lay in Sion a chief corner stone, elect, precious: and he that believeth on him shall not be confounded. Unto you therefore which believe he is precious.

title: Possession of the Spirit of Christ
bible_verse: Ye are not in the flesh, but in the Spirit, if so be that the Spirit of God dwell in you. Now if any man have not the Spirit of Christ, he is none of his.

title: Led by the Spirit
bible_verse: For as many as are led by the Spirit of God, they are the sons of God.

title: Conviction of Sin
poem:
O Thou that hear'st the prayer of faith,
Wilt thou not save my soul from death,
My soul that rests on thee?
I have no refuge of my own,
But fly to what my Lord hath done
And suffer'd once for me.
bible_verse: There is no soundness in my flesh because of thine anger; neither is there any rest in my bones because of my sin. For mine iniquities are gone over mine head: as an heavy burden they are too heavy for me.

title: Repentance for Sin
poem:
My lips with shame my sins confess
Against thy law, against thy grace:
Lord, should thy judgments grow severe,
I am condemn'd, but thou art clear.
bible_verse: Godly sorrow worketh repentance to salvation not to be repented of: but the sorrow of the world worketh death.

title: Hatred of Sin
poem:
Oh! give, Lord, the tender heart
That trembles at th' approach of sin,
A godly fear of sin impart,
Implant and root it deep within.
bible_verse: Whosoever is born of God doth not commit sin; for his seed remaineth in him: and he cannot sin, because he is born of God.

title: Mortification of Sin
bible_verse: They that are Christ's have crucified the flesh with the affections and lusts.

title: Self-Righteousness Renounced
poem:
On thee alone my hope relies:
Beneath the cross I fall,
My Lord, my life, my sacrifice
My Saviour, and my all.
bible_verse: Yea doubtless, and I count all things but loss for the excellency of the knowledge of Christ Jesus my Lord: for whom I have suffered the loss of all things, and do count them but dung, that I may win Christ.

title: The World Overcome by Faith
poem:
'Tis faith that conquers earth and hell
By a celestial power;
This is the grace that shall prevail
In the decisive hour.
bible_verse: Whatsoever is born of God overcometh the world: and this is the victory that overcometh the world, even our faith.

title: Non-Conformity to the World
poem:
Why should our poor enjoyments here
Be thought so pleasant and so dear,
And tempt our hearts astray?
Our brightest joys are fading fast,
The longest life will soon be past;
And if we go to heaven at last,
We need not wish to stay.
bible_verse: Love not the world, neither the things that are in the world. If any man love the world, the love of the Father is not in him.

title: Spiritual-Mindedness
poem:
Let worldly minds the world pursue,
It has no charms for me;
Once I admired its trifles too,
But grace has set me free.
bible_verse: They that are after the flesh do mind the things of the flesh; but they that are after the Spirit the things of the Spirit.

title: Heavenly-Mindedness
poem:
Beyond the bounds of time and space
Look forward to that heavenly place,
The saints' secure abode;
On faith's strong eagle pinions rise,
And force your passage to the skies,
Strong in the strength of God.
bible_verse: Our conversation is in heaven; from whence also we look for the Savior, the Lord Jesus Christ.

title: Constrained by Love
poem:
Be all my heart, be all my days,
Devoted to thy single praise;
And let my glad obedience prove
How much I owe, how much I love.
bible_verse: The love of Christ constraineth us; because we thus judge, that if one died for all, then were all dead: and that he died for all, that they which live should not henceforth live unto themselves, but unto him which died for them, and rose again.

title: Love of the Truth
poem:
Order my footsteps by thy word,
And make my heart sincere;
Let sin have no dominion, Lord,
But keep my conscience clear.
bible_verse: We are of God: he that knoweth God heareth us; he that is not of God heareth not us. Hereby know we the spirit of truth, and the spirit of error.

title: Perseverance in the Truth
poem:
When any turn from Zion's way,
(Alas, what numbers do!)
Methinks I hear my Saviour say,
Wilt thou forsake me too?
bible_verse: They went out from us, but they were not of us; for if they had been of us, they would no doubt have continued with us: but they went out, that they might be made manifest that they were not all of us.

title: Love of the Scriptures
poem:
Here mines of knowledge, love, and joy,
Are opened to our sight—
The purest gold without alloy,
And gems divinely bright.
bible_verse: I love thy commandments above gold; yea, above fine gold. Thy testimonies are wonderful: therefore doth my soul keep them.

title: Love of Enemies
poem:
Lord, shall thy bright example shine
In vain before my eyes?
Give me a soul akin to thine,
To love my enemies.
bible_verse: Love ye your enemies, and do good, and lend, hoping for nothing again; and your reward shall be great, and ye shall be the children of the Highest: for he is kind unto the unthankful and to the evil.

title: Love of the Brethren
poem:
Blest be the tie that binds
Our hearts in Christian love;
The fellowship of kindred minds
Is like to that above.
bible_verse: Beloved, let us love one another: for love is of God: and every one that loveth is born of God, and knoweth God.

title: The Witness of Conscience
poem:
How happy are the new-born race,
Partakers of adopting grace!
How pure the bliss they share!
Hid from the world and all its eyes,
Within their hearts the blessing lies,
And conscience feels it there.
bible_verse: Hereby we know that we are of the truth, and shall assure our hearts before him. Beloved, if our heart condemn us not, then have we confidence toward God.

title: God the Believer's Sun and Shield
poem:
If thou art my shield and my sun,
The night is no darkness to me;
And fast as my moments roll on,
They bring me but nearer to thee.
bible_verse: The Lord God is a sun and shield: the Lord will give grace and glory; no good thing will he withhold from them that walk uprightly.

title: God the Portion  of the Believer
poem:
His boundless grace shall all my need supply,
When streams of creature-comfort cease to flow:
And should he some inferior good deny,
'Tis but a greater blessing to bestow.
bible_verse: God is the strength of my heart, and my portion for ever.

title: God the Refuge of the Believer
poem:
God is our refuge in distress,
A present help when dangers press;
In him undaunted I'll confide,
Though earth were from her centre tossed,
And mountains in the ocean lost,
Torn piece-meal by the roaring tide.
bible_verse: God is our refuge and strength, a very present help in trouble. Therefore will not we fear, though the earth be removed, and though the mountains be carried into the midst of the sea.

title: God the Guide of the Believer
poem:
Haste thee on from grace to glory,
Armed by faith, and winged by prayer;
Heaven's eternal day's before thee,
God's own hand shall guide thee there.
bible_verse: This God is our God for ever and ever: he will be our guide even unto death.

title: God the Glory of the Believer
poem:
Lord, let thy grace surround me still,
And like a bulwark prove!
To guard my soul from every ill,
Secured by sovereign love.
bible_verse: Thou, Lord, art a shield for me; my glory, and the lifter up of mine head.

title: All Blessings Through Christ
poem:
Let Christ assure me he is mine,
I nothing want beside;
My soul shall at the fountain live,
When all the streams are dried.
bible_verse: All things are yours; whether Paul, or Apollos, or Cephas, or the world, or life, or death, or things present, or things to come; all are yours; and ye are Christ's; and Christ is God's.

title: All Blessings in Christ
poem:
Oh the rich depths of love divine!
Of bliss a boundless store!
Dear Savior, let me call thee mine,
I cannot wish for more.
bible_verse: Blessed be the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, who hath blessed us with all spiritual blessings in heavenly places in Christ Jesus.

title: Pardon Through Christ
poem:
O Lamb of God, thy precious blood
Shall never lose its power,
Till all the ransomed church of God
Be saved, to sin no more.

E'er since, by faith, I saw the stream
Thy flowing wounds supply,
Redeeming love has been my theme,
And shall be till I die.
bible_verse: In whom we have redemption through his blood, even the forgiveness of sin.

title: Justification Through Christ
poem:
No righteousness but his we own,
No ransom but his blood alone:
While on the Father's name we call,
Our faith pleads Christ as all in all.
bible_verse: Being justified freely by his grace through the redemption that is in Christ Jesus.

title: Reconciliation Through Christ
poem:
Let us love, and sing, and wonder;
Let us praise the Savior's name:
He has hushed the law's loud thunder,
He has quenched Mount Sinai's flame:
He has washed us with his blood,
He has brought us nigh to God.
bible_verse: For if, when we were enemies, we were reconciled to God by the death of his Son, much more, being reconciled, we shall be saved by his life.

title: Adoption Through Christ
poem:
Let others boast their ancient line,
In long succession great;
In the proud list, let heroes shine
And monarchs swell their state:
Descended from the King of kings,
Each saint a nobler title sings.
bible_verse: As many as received him, to them gave he power to become the sons of God, even to them that believe on his name.

title: Rest in Christ
poem:
Jesus, with thy word complying,
Firm our faith and hope shall be;
On thy faithfulness relying,
We will seek our rest in thee.
bible_verse: Come unto me, all ye that labor and are heavy laden, and I will give you rest.

title: Safety in Christ
poem:
"Unnumbered years of bliss
I to my sheep will give;
And while my throne unshaken stands
Shall all my chosen live."

Enough, my gracious Lord,
Let faith triumphant cry;
My heart can on this promise live,
Can with this promise die.
bible_verse: I give unto them eternal life; and they shall never perish, neither shall any man pluck them out of my hand.

title: Strength Through Christ
poem:
I can do all things, and can bear
All sufferings, if my Lord be near;
Sweet pleasures mingle with the pains,
While his left hand my head sustains.
bible_verse: I can do all things through Christ which strengtheneth me.

title: Spiritual Freedom Through Christ
poem:
Sweet is the freedom Christ bestows,
With which he makes his people free,
A liberty no mortal knows
Till they his great salvation see.
bible_verse: If the Son shall make you free, ye shall be free indeed.

title: Consolation Through Christ
poem:
In every trouble, sharp and strong,
My soul to Jesus flies;
My anchor-hold is firm on him,
When swelling billows rise.
bible_verse: Now our Lord Jesus Christ himself, and God, even our Father, which hath loved us, and hath given us everlasting consolation and good hope through grace.

title: Peace with God Through Christ
poem:
No fiery vengeance now,
Nor buring wrath comes down;
If justice calls for sinners' blood,
The Saviour shows his own.
bible_verse: Being justified by faith, we have peace with God through our Lord Jesus Christ.

title: Access to God Through Christ
poem:
Come boldy to the throne of grace,
Where Jesus kindly pleads;
Ours cannot be a desperate case
While Jesus intercedes.
bible_verse: In whom we have boldness and access with confidence by the faith of him.

title: Victory Through Christ
poem:
Thus strong in the Redeemer's strength,
Sin, death, and hell we tranple down,
Fight the good fight, and win at length,
Through mercy, an eternal crown.
bible_verse: Thanks be to God, which giveth us the victory through our Lord Jesus Christ.

title: Indwelling of the Spirit
bible_verse: Know ye not that ye are the temple of God, and that the Spirit of God dwelleth in you?

title: Intercession of the Spirit
poem:
Let pure devotion's fervours rise,
Let every holy feeling glow;
Oh, let the rapture of the skies
Kindle in our cold hearts below.
Come, vivifying Spirit, come,
And make our hearts thy constant home.
bible_verse: The Spirit also helpeth our infirmities: for we know not what we should pray for as we ought: but the Spirit itself maketh intercession for us with groanings which cannot be uttered.

title: Sanctification by the Spirit
poem:
Can aught beneath a power divine
The stubborn will subdue?
'Tis thine, eternal Spirit, thine,
To form our hearts anew.
'Tis thine the passions to recall,
And upwards bid them rise;
And make the scales of error fall
From reason's darkened eyes.
bible_verse: Elect according to the foreknowledge of God the Father, through sanctification of the Spirit, unto obedience and sprinkling of the blood of Jesus.

title: The Fruits of the Spirit
poem:
'Tis God himself the ground prepares,
His Spirit sows the land;
And every pleasant fruit it bears,
Is nurtured by his hand.
bible_verse: The fruit of the Spirit is love, joy, peace, long-suffering, gentleness, goodness, faith, meekness, temperance: against such there is no law.

title: Inheritance Among the Sanctified
poem:
From earth we shall quickly remove,
And mount to our native abode;
The house of our Father above,
The palace of angels and God.
bible_verse: Brethren, I commend you to God, and to the word of his grace, which is able to build you up, and to give you an inheritance among all them which are sanctified.

title: Increase of Grace
poem:
Lord, one thing we want,
More holiness grant;
For more of thy mind and thy image we pant:
While onward we move
To Canaan above,
Come, fill us with holiness, fill us with love.
bible_verse: The righteous shall flourish like the palm tree: he shall grow like a cedar in Lebanon. They shall still bring forth fruit in old age; they shall be fat and flourishing.

title: Persevering Grace
poem:
The righteous, bless'd with light divine,
Shall prosper on their way;
Brighter and brighter still shall shine,
To glory's perfect day.
bible_verse: The righteous shall hold on his way, and he that hath clean hands shall be stronger and stronger.

title: Confidence in Prayer
poem:
He who for man their Surety stood,
And poured on earth his precious blood,
Pursues in heaven his mighty plan,
The Saviour and the friend of man.

With boldness, therefore, at the throne,
Let us make all our sorrows known;
And ask the aid of heavenly power,
To help us in the evil hour.
bible_verse: This is the confidence that we have in him, that, if we ask any thing according to his will, he heareth us.

title: Preservation in Trouble
poem:
When I can trust my all with God,
In trial's fearful hour—
Bow, all resigned, beneath his rod,
And bless his sparing power;
A joy springs up amid distress,
A fountain in the wilderness.
bible_verse: In the time of trouble he shall hide me in his pavilion: in the secret of his tabernacle shall he hide me; he shall set me upon a rock.

title: All Things Work Together for Good
bible_verse: We know that all things work together for good to them that love God, to them who are the called according to his purpose.

title: Peace of Mind
poem:
Saviour, on earth I covet not
That every woe should cease;
Only, if trouble be my lot,
In thee let me have peace.
bible_verse: Thou wilt keep him in perfect peace, whose mind is stayed on thee: because he trusteth in thee.

title: Peace in Death
poem:
How blest the righteous when he dies,
When sinks a weary soul to rest!
How mildly beam the closing eyes!
How gently heaves th' expiring breast!
Life's labour done, as sinks the clay,
Light from its load the spirit flies;
While heaven and earth combine to say,
"How blest the righteous when he dies!"
bible_verse: Mark the perfect man, and behold the upright: for the end of that man is peace.

title: Good Works to Be Done
poem:
Whate'er is noble, pure, refined,
Just, generous, amiable, and kind,
That may my constant thoughts pursue,
That may I love and practise too.
bible_verse: These things I will that thou affirm constantly, that they which have believed in God might be careful to maintain good works.

title: Good Works to Be Done to the Glory of God
poem:
Through Jesus Christ the Just,
My faint desires receive;
And let me in thy goodness trust,
And to thy glory live.
bible_verse: Whether therefore ye eat, or drink, or whatsoever ye do, do all to the glory of God.

title: Good Works to Be Done After the Example of Christ
poem:
To do his heavenly Father's will
Was his employment and delight;
Humility and holy zeal
Shone through his life divinely bright.
bible_verse: He that saith he abideth in him ought himself also so to walk, even as he walked.

title: Good Works to Be Done Through the Grace of Christ
poem:
Then shall we do, with pure delight,
Whate'er is pleasing in thy sight,
As vessels of thy richest grace;
And, having thy whole counsel done,
To thee and thy co-equal Son
Ascribe the everlasting praise.
bible_verse: Now the God of peace make you perfect in every good work to do his will, working in you that which is well pleasing in his sight, through Jesus Christ; to whom be glory for ever and ever.

title: Good Works to Be Done in the Name of Christ
poem:
Whate'er I say or do,
Thy glory be my aim;
My offerings all be offered through
His ever blessed name.
bible_verse: Whatsoever ye do in word or deed, do all in the name of the Lord Jesus, giving thanks to God and the Father by him.

title: Improvement of Time
poem:
The time is short, but who can tell
How short his time below may be?
To-day on earth his soul may dwell,
To-morrow in eternity.
bible_verse: Knowing the time, that now it is high time to awake out of sleep: for now is our salvation nearer than when we believed.

title: Improvement of Privileges
poem:
Father of mercies, we have need
Of thy preparing grace;
Let the same hand that gives the seed
Provide a fruitful place.
bible_verse: That on the good ground are they, which in an honest and good heart, having heard the word, keep it, and bring forth fruit with patience.

title: Improvement of Opportunities
poem:
Whate'er our hands shall find to do,
To-day may we with zeal pursue;
Seize fleeting moments as they fly,
And live as we would wish to die.
bible_verse: Whatsoever thy hand findeth to do, do it with thy might; for there is no work, nor device, nor knowledge, nor wisdom, in the grave, whither thou goest.

title: Spiritual Diligence
poem:
A scrip on my back, and a staff in my hand,
I march on in haste through an enemy's land:
The road may be rough, but it cannot be long,
So I'll smooth it with hope, and I'll cheer it with song.
bible_verse: This one thing I do, forgetting those things which are behind, and reaching forth unto those things which are before, I press toward the mark for the prize of the high calling of God in Christ Jesus.

title: Entire Consecration
poem:
Yield to the Lord, with simple heart,
All that thou hast, and all thou art:
Renounce all strength, but strength divine,
And peace shall be for ever thine.
bible_verse: Neither yield ye your members as instruments of unrighteousness unto sin: but yield yourselves unto God, as those that are alive from the dead, and your members as instruments of righteousness unto God.

title: Open Profession of Christ
poem:
Should I, to gain the world's applause,
Or to escape its harmless frown,
Refuse to countenance thy cause,
And make thy people's lot my own,
What shame would fill me in that day,
When thou thy glory shalt display!
bible_verse: Whosoever shall confess me before men, him will I confess also before my Father which is in heaven.

title: Evil Appearances to Be Avoided
poem:
Our Saviour by a heavenly birth
Calls us to holiness on earth,
Bids us our former follies hate,
And from the wicked separate.

We must have holy hearts and hands,
And feet that go where he commands;
A holy will to keep his ways,
And holy lips to speak his praise.
bible_verse: Abstain from all appearance of evil.

title: Diligence in Keeping the Heart
poem:
Thy business be to keep thy heart,
Each passion to control;
Nobly ambitious well to rule
The empire of thy soul.
bible_verse: Keep thy heart with all diligence; for out of it are the issues of life.

title: Search the Scriptures
bible_verse: Search the Scriptures; for in them ye think ye have eternal life: and they are they which testify of me.

title: Secret Prayer
poem:
Far from the paths of men, to thee
I solemnly retire;
See Thou, who dost in secret see,
And grant my heart's desire.
bible_verse: Thou, when thou prayest, enter into thy closet, and when thou hast shut thy door, pray to thy Father which is in secret; and thy Father which seeth in secret shall reward thee openly.

title: Thanksgiving
poem:
Praise to God, immortal praise,
For the love that crowns our days;
Bounteous Source of every joy,
Let thy praise our tongues employ.
bible_verse: In every thing give thanks: for this is the will of God in Christ Jesus concerning you.

title: Meditation
poem:
I love in solitude to shed
The penitential tear;
And all his promises to plead,
When none but God is near.

I love to think on mercies past,
And future good implore;
And all my cares and sorrows cast,
On him whom I adore.
bible_verse: His delight is in the law of the Lord; and in his law doth he meditate day and night.

title: Self-Examination
poem:
At evening to myself I say,
My soul, where hast thou gleaned to-day,
Thy labours how bestowed?
What hast thou rightly said or done?
What grace attained, or knowledge won,
In following after God?
bible_verse: Examine yourselves, whether ye be in the faith; prove your own selves.

title: In Prosperity to Be Humble
poem:
Lord, if thou thy grace impart,
Poor in spirit, meek in heart,
I shall, as my Saviour, be
Rooted in humility:
Pleased with all the Lord provides,
Weaned from all the world besides.
bible_verse: For I say, through the grace given unto me, to every man that is among you, not to think of himself more highly than he ought to think.

title: In Adversity to Trust God
poem:
If Providence our comforts shroud,
And dark distresses lower,
Hope paints its rainbow on the cloud,
And grace shines through the shower.
bible_verse: Who is among you that feareth the Lord, that obeyeth the voice of his servant, that walketh in darkness, and hath no light? let him trust in the name of the Lord, and stay upon his God.

title: Self-Government
poem:
Happy the man, whose cautious steps
Still keep the golden mean;
Whose life, by Scriputre rules well form'd,
Declares a conscience clean.
bible_verse: He that is slow to anger is better than the mighty; and he that ruleth his spirit than he that taketh a city.

title: Self-Denial
poem:
Lord, ever let me freely yield
What most I prize to thee,
Who never hast a good withheld,
Or wilt withhold from me.

Thy favour all my journey through,
Thou art engaged to grant;
What else I want, or think I do,
'Tis better still to want.
bible_verse: All things are lawful for me, but all things are not expedient: all things are lawful for me, but all things edify not.

title: Contentment
poem:
Since he has said "I'll ne'er depart,"
I'll bind his promise to my heart,
Rejoicing in his care:
This shall support while here I live,
And when in glory I arrive,
Will praise him for it there.
bible_verse: Be content with such things as ye have: for he hath said, I will never leave thee, nor forsake thee.

title: Patience
poem:
I would submit to all thy will,
For thou art good and wise;
Let every anxious thought be still,
Nor one faint murmur rise.

Thy love can cheer the darksome gloom,
And bid me wait serene,
Till hopes and joys immortal bloom
And brighten all the scene.
bible_verse: Ye have need of patience, that, after ye have done the will of God, ye might receive the promise.

title: Meekness
poem:
Meekness, humility, and love,
Did through thy conduct shine;
Oh may my whole deportment prove
A copy, Lord, of thine.
bible_verse: Walk worthy of the vocation wherewith ye are called, with all lowliness and meekness, with long suffering, forbearing one another in love.

title: Temperance
poem:
The world employs its various snares,
Of hopes and pleasures, pains and cares,
And chained to earth I lie:
When shall my fettered powers be free,
And leave these seats of vanity,
And upward learn to fly?
bible_verse: Take heed to yourselves, lest at any time your hearts be overcharged with surfeiting, and drunkenness, and cares of this life, and so that day come upon you unawares.

title: Gravity and Sincerity
poem:
Pure may I be, averse to sin,
Just, holy, merciful, and true;
And let thine image formed within,
Shine out in all I speak or do.
bible_verse: In all things showing thyself a pattern of good works: in doctrine showing uncorruptness, gravity, sincerity.

title: Watchfulness
poem:
Arm me with jealous care,
As in thy sight to live:
And oh, thy servant, Lord, prepare,
A strict account to give.

Help me to watch and pray,
And on thyself rely;
Assured if I my trust betray,
I shall for ever die.
bible_verse: Blessed are those servants, whom the Lord when he cometh shall find watching: verily I say unto you, that he shall gird himself, and make them to sit down to meat, and will come forth and serve them.

title: Diligence in Worldly Calling
poem:
Midst hourly cares, may love present
Its incense to thy throne;
And while the world our hands employs,
Our hearts be thine alone.
bible_verse: Study to be quiet, and to do your own business, and to work with your own hands, as we commanded you.

title: Eminent Holiness the Desire of the Believer
poem:
Oh for a closer walk with God,
A calm and heavenly frame,
A light to shine upon the road
That leads me to the Lamb!
bible_verse: Not as though I had already attained, either were already perfect: but I follow after, if that I may apprehend that for which also I am apprehended of Jesus Christ.

title: To Show Forth the Praises of God
poem:
Not by your words alone,
But by your actions show
How much from him you have received,
How much to him you owe.
bible_verse: Ye are a chosen generation, a royal priesthood, an holy nation, a peculiar people; that ye should show forth the praises of him who hath called you out of darkness into his marvellous light.

title: To Depart from All Iniquity
poem:
Faith must obey her Father's will,
As well as trust his grace;
A pardoning God is jealous still
For his own holiness.
bible_verse: Let every one that nameth the name of Christ depart from iniquity.

title: Steadfastness in the Faith
poem:
From Egypt lately freed
By the Redeemer's grace,
A rough and thorny path we tread
In hopes to see his face.
The flesh dislikes the way,
But faith approves it well;
This only leads to endless day,
All others lead to hell.
bible_verse: Stand fast in the liberty wherewith Christ hath made us free, and be not entangled again with the yoke of bondage.

title: Zeal in Defence of the Gospel
poem:
In conquests of thy might,
May I loyally delight:
In thy ever-spreading reign,
Triumph as my greatest gain;
Make me conscious by this sign,
Gracious Saviour, I am thine.
bible_verse: —exhort you that ye should earnestly contend for the faith which was once delivered unto the saints.

title: Zeal for Good Works
poem:
Awake, my soul, awake, my love,
And serve my Saviour here below,
In works which all the saints above
And holy angels cannot do.
bible_verse: Let us consider one another to provoke unto love and to good works.

title: Zeal for Divine Worship
poem:
Oh let me always find a place,
Within the temples of thy grace;
Till God command my last remove,
To dwell in temples made above!
bible_verse: Not forsaking the assembling of ourselves together, as the manner of some is; but exhorting one another: and so much the more, as ye see the day approaching.

title: Concern for the Peace of the Church
poem:
Make us of one heart and mind,
Courteous, pitiful, and kind;
Lowly, meek in thought and word,
Altogether like our Lord.
bible_verse: Be perfect, be of good comfort, be of one mind, live in peace; and the God of love and peace shall be with you.

title: Concern for the Prosperity of the Church
poem:
For our dear brethren's sake,
Zion, we wish thee peace;
Prosper, oh! prosper long,
And may thy sons increase:
We seek thy good, we love the road,
Which leads us to God's blest abode.
bible_verse: Peace be within thy walls and prosperity within thy palaces.

title: Mutual Love
poem:
Among the saints on earth
Let mutual love be found;
Heirs of the same inheritance,
With mutual blessings crowned.
bible_verse: Walk in love, as Christ also hath loved us, and hath given himself for us an offering and a sacrifice to God for a sweet-smelling savour.

title: Mutual Subjection
bible_verse: All of you be subject one to another, and be clothed with humility: for God resisteth the proud, and giveth grace to the humble.

title: Mutual Honour
poem:
Oh let each esteem his brother
Better than himself to be;
And let each prefer another,
Full of love, from envy free:
Happy are we,
When in this we all agree.
bible_verse: Let nothing be done through strife or vainglory; but in lowliness of mind let each esteem other better than themselves.

title: Mutual Forbearance
poem:
May we each with each agree,
Through thy uniting grace:
Our gift shall thine accepted be,
Our life be love and praise.
bible_verse: Forbearing one another, and forgiving one another, if any man have a quarrel against any: even as Christ forgave you, so also do ye.

title: Mutual Candour
poem:
Make us, by thy transforming grace,
Great Saviour, daily more like thee;
Thy fair example may we trace,
To teach us what we ought to be.
bible_verse: Judge not, that ye be not judged. Why beholdest thou the mote that is in thy brother's eye, but considerest not the beam that is in thine own eye?

title: Mutual Forgiveness
poem:
"Is Christ divided?" What can part
The members from the Head?
Oh how should those be one in heart
For whom our Saviour bled!
bible_verse: Be ye kind one to another, tenderhearted, forgiving one another, even as God for Christ's sake hath forgiven you.

title: Mutual Admonition
poem:
Bonds of everlasting love
Draw our souls in union
To our Father's house above,
To the saints' communion.
Thither may our hopes ascend,
There may all our labours end.
bible_verse: I myself am persuaded of you, mu brethren, that ye also are full of goodness, filled with all knowledge, able also to admonish one another.

title: Mutual Consolation and Edification
poem:
While we journey, let us
Help each other on the road;
Foes on every side beset us,
Snares through all the way are strewed:
It behoves us,
Each to bear a brother's load.
bible_verse: Comfort yourselves together, and edify one another, even as also ye do.

title: Mutual Intercession
poem:
Before our Father's throne
We pour our ardent prayers;
Our fears, our hopes, our aims are one—
Our comforts and our cares.
bible_verse: Pray one for another.—The effectual fervent prayer of a righteous man availeth much.

title: Unity of Sentiment
poem:
Bound to one Lord, by common vow
In one great enterprise;
One faith, one hope, one centre now,
Our common home, the skies.
bible_verse: Whereto we have already attained, let us walk by the same rule, let us mind the same thing.

title: Unity of Judgment
poem:
Lord subdue our selfish will,
Each to each our tempers suit,
By thy modulating skill,
Heart to heart; as lute to lute.
bible_verse: I beseech you, brethren, by the name of our Lord Jesus Christ, that ye all speak the same thing, and that there be no divisions among you; but that ye be perfectly joined together in the same mind and in the same judgment.

title: United Prayer
poem:
Where two or three with sweet accord,
Obedient to their sovereign, Lord,
Meet to recount his acts of grace,
And offer solemn prayer and praise;
There, saith the Savior, will I be
Amid the little company.
bible_verse: Where two or three are gathered together in my name, there am I in the midst of them.

title: United Praise
poem:
Teach us, though in a world of sin,
Heaven's blest employment to begin,
To sing our great Redeemer's praise;
And love his name, and learn his ways.
bible_verse: Teaching and admonishing one another in psalms and hymns and spiritual songs, singing with grace in your hearts to the Lord.

title: Pious Conversation
poem:
Wheresoever two or three
Meet, a Christian company,
Grant us, Lord, to meet with thee:
Gracious Saviour, hear!
When with friends beloved we stray,
Talking down the closing day,
Saviour, meet us in the way:
Gracious Saviour, hear!
bible_verse: Let no corrupt communication proceed out of your mouth, but that which is good to the use of edifying, that it may minister grace unto the hearers.

title: Compassion for the Weak
poem:
When weaker Christians we despise,
We do the great Redeemer wrong;
For God, the gracious and the wise,
Receives the feeble with the strong.
bible_verse: We that are strong ought to bear the infirmities of the weak, and not to please ourselves.

title: Compassion for the Afflicted
poem:
With pity let my breast o'erflow,
When I behold another's woe;
And bear a sympathizing part,
Whene'er I meet a wounded heart.
bible_verse: Remember them that are in bonds, as bound with them; and them which suffer adversity, as being yourselves also in the body.

title: Compassion for the Poor
poem:
Awake, my charity, and feed
The hungry soul, and clothe the poor;
In heaven are found no sons of need,
There all these duties are no more.
bible_verse: As we have therefore opportunity, let us do good unto all men, especially unto them who are of the household of faith.

title: Compassion to Those Who Have Erred
poem:
Lord, we would strive, and hope, and wait,
The offending still to reinstate;
And when a broken heart we view,
Our Christian friendship quick renew.
bible_verse: Brethren, if a man be overtaken in a fault, ye which are spiritual, restore such an one in the spirit of meekness; considering thyself, lest thou also be tempted.

title: Freedom from Slander
poem:
Love is a pure and heavenly flame,
And much regards a brother's name;
It hopeth all things, and believes,
Nor easily a charge receives.
bible_verse: Speak not evil one of another, brethren. He that speaketh evil of his brother, and judgeth his brother, speaketh evil of the law, and judgeth the law: but if thou judge the law, thou art not a doer of the law, but a judge.

title: Esteem for the Ministry
poem:
How beauteous are their feet,
Who stand on Zion's hill;
Who bring salvation on their tongues,
And words of peace reveal!
bible_verse: We beseech you to know them which labour among you, and are over you in the Lord, and admonish you; and to esteem them very highly in love for their work's sake.

title: Prayer for the Ministry
poem:
With heavenly power, O Lord, defend
Those whom we now to thee commend,
Thy faithful messengers secure,
And make them to the end endure.
bible_verse: Praying always with all prayer and supplication in the Spirit;—and for me, that utterance may be given unto me, that I may open my mouth boldly, to make known the mystery of the gospel.

title: Unbelief Should Be Guarded Against
poem:
How oft, deceived by self and pride,
Has my weak heart been turned aside,
And, Jonah-like, has fled from thee,
Till thou hast looked again on me!
bible_verse: Take heed, brethren, lest there be in any of you an evil heart of unbelief, in departing from the living God.

title: Caution Against Apostasy
poem:
What bright exchange, what treasure shall be given,
For the lost birthright of a hope in heaven?
If lost the gem which empires could not buy,
What yet remains?—a dark eternity.
bible_verse: Looking diligently lest any man fail of the grace of God; lest any root of bitterness springing up trouble you, and thereby many be defiled.

title: Believers Are the Salt of the Earth
poem:
Strive thou with studious care to find
Some good thy hands may do;
Some way to serve and bless mankind,
Console the heart, relieve the mind,
And open comforts new.
bible_verse: Ye are the salt of the earth: but if the salt have lost his savour, wherewith shall it be salted? it is thenceforth good for nothing, but to be cast out, and to be trodden under foot of men.

title: Believers Are the Light of the World
poem:
Walk in the light—and thine shall be
A path, though stormy, bright;
For God in love shall dwell with thee—
And God himself is light.
bible_verse: Ye are the light of the world.

title: The Universal Rule of Equity
poem:
Blessed Redeemer, how divine,
How righteous is this rule of thine,
To do to all men just the same
As we expect or wish from them!

How blest would every nation prove
Thus ruled by equity and love!
All would be friends without a foe,
And form a paradise below.
bible_verse: All things whatsoever ye would that men should do to you, do ye even so to them: for this is the law and the prophets.

title: To Glorify God by Holy Conduct
poem:
Help thy servant to maintain
A profession free from stain;
That my sole reproach may be,
Following Christ, and fearing thee.
bible_verse: I beseech you as strangers and pilgrims, abstain from fleshly lusts, which war against the soul; having your conversation honest among the Gentiles.

title: Abounding in the Work of the Lord
poem:
Sow in the morn thy seed,
At eve hold not thy hand,
To doubt and fear give thou no heed,
Broad-cast it round thy land.
bible_verse: My beloved brethren, be ye steadfast, unmovable, always abounding in the work of the Lord, forasmuch as ye know that your labour is not in vain in the Lord.

title: Decision of Character
poem:
Not a broken, brief obedience
Does the Lord of heaven demand;
He requires our whole allegiance.
Words and deeds, and heart and hand:
God will hold divided sway
With no deity of clay.
bible_verse: No man can serve two masters: for either he will hate the one, and love the other; or else he will hold to the one, and despise the other. Ye cannot serve God and mammon.

title: Holy Example
poem:
So let our lips and lives express
The holy gospel we profess;
So let our works and virtues shine
To prove the doctrine all divine.
bible_verse: Let your light so shine before men, that they may see your good works, and glorify your Father which is in heaven.

title: Live in Peace with All Men
poem:
His purpose is that we should bear
His image now on earth,
And by our peaceful lives declare
Our new and heavenly birth.
bible_verse: If it be possible, as much as lieth in you, live peaceably with all men.

title: Love to Our Neighbor
poem:
Love lays its own advantage by
To seek its neighbour's good;
So God's own Son came down to die,
And bought our lives with blood.

Love is the grace that keeps its power
In all the realms above;
There faith and hope are known no more
But saints for ever love.
bible_verse: If ye fulfil the royal law according to the scripture, Thou shalt love thy neighbour as thyself, ye do well.

title: Seek the Edification of Our Neighbour
poem:
May I from every act abstain,
That hurts or gives another pain:
Still may I feel my heart inclined
To be the friend of all mankind.
bible_verse: Let every one of us please his neighbour for his good to edification.

title: Love to All Men
poem:
May love, that shining grace,
O'er all my powers preside;
Direct my thoughts, suggest my words,
And every action guide.
bible_verse: The Lord make you to increase and abound in love one toward another, and toward all men, even as we do toward you.

title: To Seek the Salvation of Others
bible_verse: He which converteth the sinner from the error of his way shall save a soul from death, and shall hide a multitude of sins.

title: Give Due Honour to All
poem:
Long as the moon her course shall run,
Or man behold the circling sun,
Do thou amidst our nation reign;
Still crown her counsels with success,
With peace and joy her borders bless,
And all her sacred rights maintain.
bible_verse: Render to all their dues: tribute to whom tribute is due; custom to whom custom; fear to whom fear; honour to whom honour.

title: Consistency
poem:
That wisdom, Lord, on us bestow
From every evil to depart,
To stop the mouth of every foe,
While upright both in life and heart,
The proof of godly fear we give,
And show them how the Christians live.
bible_verse: That ye may be blameless and harmless, the sons of God, without rebuke, in the midst of a crooked and perverse nation, among whom ye shine as lights in the world.

title: Circumspection
poem:
Let every flying hour confess
I gain the gospel fresh renown;
And when my life and labours cease,
May I possess the promised crown.
bible_verse: See then that ye walk circumspectly, not as fools, but as wise; redeeming the time, because the days are evil.

title: Discretion
poem:
Believers love what God commands,
And in his ways delight;
Their gracious words, and holy hands
Show that their faith is right.

Their converse is with God above,
Their labours bless mankind;
Their works of mercy, peace, and love,
Through Christ acceptance find.
bible_verse: A good man sheweth favour, and lendeth: he will guide his affairs with discretion.

title: Moderation
poem:
We'll look on all the toys below
With such disdain as angels do;
And wait the call that bids us rise
To mansions promised in the skies.
bible_verse: Let your moderation be known unto all men. The Lord is at hand.

title: Forbearance
poem:
May I feel beneath my wrongs
Vengeance to the Lord belongs:
Nor a worse requital dare,
Than meek revenge of prayer:
Much forgiven, may I learn,
Love for hatred to return.
bible_verse: Dearly beloved, avenge not yourselves, but rather give place unto wrath: for it is written, Vengeance is mine; I will repay, saith the Lord.

title: Industry
bible_verse: Let a man labour, working with his hands the thing which is good, that ye may have to give to him that needeth.

title: Integrity
poem:
Come, let us search our ways and try,
Have they been just and right?
Is the great rule of equity
Our practice and delight?

In all we sell, in all we buy,
Is justice our design?
Do we remember God is nigh,
And fear the wrath Divine?
bible_verse: That ye may walk honestly toward them that are without, and that ye may have lack of nothing.

title: Fidelity
poem:
Thy gifts are only then enjoyed
When used as talents lent;
Those talents only well employed
When in His service spent.
bible_verse: He that is faithful in that which is least is faithful also in much: and he that is unjust in the least is unjust also in much.

title: Truth and Sincerity
poem:
Let those who bear the Christian name
Their holy vows fulfil;
The saints, the followers of the Lamb,
Are men of honour still.
bible_verse: Wherefore, putting away lying, speak every man truth with his neighbour: for we are members one of another.

title: Gentleness and Meekness
poem:
Blest are the men of peaceful life,
Who quench the coals of growing strife,
They shall be called the heirs of bliss,
The sons of God, the sons of peace.
bible_verse: To speak evil of no man, to be no brawlers, but gentle, showing all meekness to all men.

title: Benevolence
poem:
The poor are always with us here:
'Tis our great Father's plan,
That mutual wants and mutual care
Should bind us man to man.
bible_verse: Pure religion and undefiled before God and the Father is this, To visit the fatherless and widows in their affliction, and to keep himself unspotted from the world.

title: Overcome Evil with Good
poem:
Thus artists melt the sullen ore of lead,
With heaping coals of fire upon its head;
In the kind warmth the metal learns to glow,
And loose from dross the silver runs below.
bible_verse: If thine enemy hunger, feed him: if he thirst, give him drink: for in so doing thou shalt heap coals of fire on his head. Be not overcome of evil, but overcome evil with good.

title: Perseverance in Doing Good
poem:
Meek pilgrim Zionward, if thou
Hast put thy hand unto the plough,
Oh look not back, nor droop dismayed,
At thought of victory delayed:
Doubt not that thou, in season due,
Shall own his gracious promise true;
And thou shalt share their glorious lot,
Whom doing well hath wearied not.
bible_verse: Let us not be weary in well doing: for in due season we shall reap if we faint not.

title: Submission to Authority
bible_verse: Put them in mind to be subject to principalities and powers, to obey magistrates, to be ready to every good work.

title: Universal Holiness the Believer's Aim
poem:
Father of eternal grace,
Glorify thyself in me;
Meekly beaming in my face,
May the world thine image see.
bible_verse: Whatsoever things are true, whatsoever things are honest, whatsoever things are just, whatsoever things are pure, whatsoever things are lovely, whatsoever things are of good report; if there be any virtue, and if there be any praise, think on these things.

title: Believer's Humble Confession
poem:
My present triumphs, and my past,
Are thine, and must be to the last;
And if the crown of life I wear,
Thy hand alone must place it there.
bible_verse: So likewise ye, when ye shall have done all those things which are commanded you, say, We are unprofitable servants: we have done that which was our duty to do.

title: The Great Motive to All Duty
poem:
Oh! grant us, Lord, to feel and own
The power of love divine;
The blood which doth for sin atone,
The grace which makes us thine.
bible_verse: Ye are not your own; for ye are bought with a price: therefore glorify God in your body, and in your spirit, which are God's.

title: Joy in God
poem:
When with his smiles my soul he deigns to bless,
Nor cares nor crosses can my peace destroy,
Possessing all things if I him possess,
Enjoying all things if I him enjoy.
bible_verse: Let all those that put their trust in thee rejoice: let them ever shout for joy, because thou defendest them: let them also that love thy name be joyful in thee.

title: Joy in Christ
poem:
The opening heavens around me shine
With beams of sacred bliss,
While Jesus shows his heart is mine,
And whispers, I am his.
bible_verse: We are the circumcision, which worship God in the spirit, and rejoice in Christ Jesus, and have no confidence in the flesh.

title: Joy in the Holy Ghost
poem:
Holy Ghost, dispel our sadness,
Pierce the cloud of sinful night;
Come, thou source of joy and gladness,
Breathe thy life, and shed thy light.
bible_verse: The kingdom of God is not meat and drink; but righteousness, and peace, and joy in the Holy Ghost.

title: The Gospel a Source of Joy
poem:
Blest are the souls that hear and know
The gospel's joyful sound;
Peace shall attend the path they go,
And light their steps surround.
bible_verse: Blessed is the people that know the joyful sound: they shall walk, O Lord, in the light of thy countenance.

title: The Atonement a Source of Joy
poem:
There is a fountain filled with blood,
Drawn from Immanuel's veins,
And sinners plunged beneath that flood
Lose all their guilty stains.

The dying thief rejoiced to see
That fountain in his day;
And here may I, though vile as he,
Wash all my sins away.
bible_verse: We joy in God through our Lord Jesus Christ, by whom we have now received the atonement.

title: The Scriptures a Source of Joy
poem:
Oh may these heavenly pages be
My ever dear delight;
And still new beauties may I see,
And still increasing light.
bible_verse: Thy words were found, and I did eat them; and thy word was unto me the joy and rejoicing of mine heart; for I am called by thy name, O Lord God of hosts.

title: The Sabbath a Source of Joy
poem:
Oft as this peaceful day shall come,
Lord, raise my thoughts from earthly things,
And bear them to my heavenly home,
On faith and hope's celestial wings:
Till the last gleam of life decay,
In one eternal Sabbath day.
bible_verse: This is the day which the Lord hath made; we will rejoice and be glad in it.

title: Faith a Source of Joy
poem:
A bleeding Saviour, seen by faith,
A sense of pardoning love,
A hope that triumphs over death,
Gives joys like those above.
bible_verse: Whom having not seen, ye love; in whom, though now ye see him not, yet believing, ye rejoice with joy unspeakable and full of glory.

title: Pardon a Source of Joy
bible_verse: Blessed is he whose transgression is forgiven, whose sin is covered. Blessed is the man unto whom the Lord imputeth not iniquity, and in whose spirit there is no guile.

title: Hope of Glory a Source of Joy
poem:
By faith to Pisgah's top I fly,
And there delighted stand,
To view beneath a cloudless sky,
The spacious promised land.

The Lord of all the vast domain
Has promised it to me;
The length and breadth of all the plain,
As far as faith can see.
bible_verse: By whom [Jesus Christ] we have access by faith into this grace wherein we stand, and rejoice in hope of the glory of God.

title: Godly Fear a Source of Joy
poem:
Happy, beyond description, he
Who fears the Lord his God;
Who hears his threats with holy awe,
And trembles at his rod.
bible_verse: Blessed is every one that feareth the Lord; that walketh in his ways. For thou shalt eat the labour of thine hands: happy shalt thou be, and it shall be well with thee.

title: Obedience a Source of Joy
poem:
Then shall my heart have inward joy,
And keep my face from shame,
When all thy statutes I obey,
And honour all thy name.
bible_verse: I will delight myself in thy commandments which I have loved.

title: Communion with God a Source of Joy
poem:
Lord, what is life? if spent with thee,
In humble praise and prayer,
How long or short my life may be
I feel no anxious care:
Though life depart, my joys shall last,
When life and all its joys are past.
bible_verse: There be many that say, Who will show us any good? Lord, lift thou up the light of thy countenance upon us. Thou hast put gladness in my heart, more than in the time that their corn and their wine increased.

title: Communion of Saints a Source of Joy
bible_verse: My goodness extendeth not to thee; but to the saints that are in the earth, and to the excellent, in whom is all my delight.

title: Prayer a Source of Joy
poem:
Prayer makes the darkened cloud withdraw,
Prayer climbs the ladder Jacob saw;
Gives exercise to faith and love,
Brings every blessing from above.
bible_verse: Even them will I bring to my holy mountain, and make them joyful in my house of prayer.

title: Salvation a Source of Joy
poem:
Salvation! oh the joyful sound!
'Tis pleasure to our ears;
A sovereign balm for every wound,
A cordial for our fears.
bible_verse: We will rejoice in thy salvation, and in the name of our God we will set up our banners.

title: Early Piety a Source of Joy
poem:
Grace is a plant, where'er it grows,
Of pure and heavenly root;
But fairest in the young it shows,
And yields the sweetest fruit.
bible_verse: Oh satisfy us early with thy mercy; that we may rejoice and be glad all our days.

title: A Good Conscience a Source of Joy
poem:
Oh happy soul, that lives on high,
While men lie grovelling here;
Whose hopes are fixed above the sky,
And faith forbids his fear.

His conscience cleansed from all his sins,
Love, peace, and joy combine
To form a life whose holy springs
Are hidden and divine.
bible_verse: Our rejoicing is this, the testimony of our conscience, that in simplicity and godly sincerity, not with fleshly wisdom, but by the grace of God, we have had our conversation in the world.

title: Benevolence a Source of Joy
poem:
Blest is the man whose heart expands
At melting pity's call,
And the rich blessings of whose hands
Like heavenly manna fall.
bible_verse: Remember the words of the Lord Jesus, how he said, It is more blessed to give than to receive.

title: Tribulation a Source of Joy
poem:
Then let us wait th' appointed day,
Nor call this world our home;
To pilgrims in a foreign land,
Afflictions needs must come.

Who rule the world, o'errules their end,
They destined are for good;
And bear the saints to realms of rest,
Though mighty as a flood.
bible_verse: We glory in tribulation: knowing that tribulation worketh patience; and patience, experience; and experience, hope.

title: Temporal Blessings Sources of Joy
poem:
Thy bounty gilds the path of life
With every cheering ray,
And oft restrains the rising tear,
Or wipes that tear away.
bible_verse: Ye shall eat in plenty, and be satisfied, and praise the name of the Lord your God, that hath dealt wondrously with you: and my people shall never be ashamed.

title: The Divine Blessing a Source of Joy
poem:
Better than life itself thy love,
Dearer than all beside to me;
For whom have I in heaven above,
Or what on earth, compared to thee?
bible_verse: The blessing of the Lord, it maketh rich, and he addeth no sorrow with it.

title: The Divine Protection a Source of Joy
poem:
Since thou hast been my help,
To thee my spirit flies;
And on thy watchful providence
My cheerful hope relies.
bible_verse: Because thou hast been my help, therefore in the shadow of thy wings will I rejoice.

title: Divine Acceptance a Source of Joy
poem:
Whilst I see thy love to me,
Every object teems with joy;
Here, oh may I walk with thee,
Then into thy presence die!
Let me but thyself possess,
Total sum of happiness;
Real bliss I then shall prove—
Heaven below, and heaven above.
bible_verse: Go thy way, eat thy bread with joy, and drink thy wine with a merry heart; for God now accepteth thy work.

title: Joy Following Sorrow
poem:
When comforts are declining,
He grants the soul again,
A season of clear shining,
To cheer it after rain.
bible_verse: Weeping may endure for a night; but joy cometh in the morning.

title: Joy the Duty of the Believer
poem:
Let those refuse to sing
Who never knew our God;
But children of the heavenly King
Should speak their joys abroad.
bible_verse: Be glad in the Lord, and rejoice, ye righteous: and shout for joy, all ye that are upright in heart.

title: Joy to be Sought Through Christ
bible_verse: Hitherto have ye asked nothing in my name: ask, and ye shall receive, that your joy may be full.

title: Believer's Joy Is Satisfying
poem:
These are the joys which satisfy,
And sanctify the mind;
Which make the spirit mount on high,
And leave the world behind.
bible_verse: Blessed is the man whom thou choosest, and causest to approach unto thee, that he may dwell in thy courts: we shall be satisfied with the goodness of thy house, even of thy holy temple.

title: Believer's Joy Is Abiding
poem:
Art thou not mine, my living Lord?
And can my hope, my comfort die,
Fixed on thine everlasting word—
The word that built the earth and sky.
bible_verse: These things have I spoken unto you, that my joy might remain in you, and that your joy might be full.

title: Believer Has Joy in Death
poem:
When we have numbered all our years,
And stand, at length, on Jordan's brink;
Though the flesh fail with mortal fears,
Oh! let not then the spirit sink:
But strong in faith, and hope, and love,
Plunge through the stream to rise above.
bible_verse: Lord, now lettest thou thy servant depart in peace, according to thy word: for mine eyes have seen thy salvation.

title: Heaven the Consummation of Joy
poem:
Soldier of Christ, well done!
Praise be thy new employ;
And while eternal ages run,
Rest in thy Saviour's joy.
bible_verse: Well done, thou good and faithful servant: thou hast been faithful over a few things. I will make thee ruler over many things: enter thou into the joy of thy Lord.

title: Believer Forewarned of Sorrow
poem:
The path of sorrow, and that path alone,
Leads to the land where sorrow is unknown.
No traveller e'er reached that blest abode,
Who found not thorns and briers in his road.
bible_verse: These things I have spoken unto you, that in me ye might have peace. In the world ye shall have tribulation: but be of good cheer; I have overcome the world.

title: Sources of Sorrow—Loss of Divine Favour
poem:
Ah! why, by passing clouds oppressed,
Should vexing thoughts distract thy breast?
Turn, turn to Him, in every pain,
Whom never suppliant sought in vain.
bible_verse: Restore unto me the joy of thy salvation; and uphold me with thy free Spirit.

title: Sources of Sorrow—Indwelling Sin
poem:
Nature may raise her fleshly strife,
Reluctant to the heavenly life:
But grace omnipotent at length
Shall arm the saint with saving strength,
Through the sharp war with aids attend,
And his last conflict sweetly end.
bible_verse: I see another law in my members, warring against the law of my mind, and bringing me into captivity to the law of sin which is in my members.

title: Sources of Sorrow—a Deceitful Heart
poem:
With flowing tears, Lord, I confess,
My folly and unsteadfestness;
When shall this heart more stable be,
Fixed by thy grace alone on thee?
bible_verse: The heart is deceitful above all things, and desperately wicked: who can know it?

title: Sources of Sorrow—Ingratitude of the Ungodly
poem:
If wounded love my bosom swell,
Deceived by those I prized too well;
He shall his pitying aid bestow,
Who felt on earth severer woe:
At once betrayed, denied, or fled,
By those who shared his daily bread.
bible_verse: They that render evil for good are mine adversaries; because I follow the thing that good is. Forsake me not, O Lord: O my God, be not far from me.

title: Sources of Sorrow—Reproach of the World
poem:
If on my face, for thy dear name,
Shame and reproach shall be,
I'll hail reproach, and welcome shame,
If thou remember me.
bible_verse: Let us go forth therefore unto him without the camp, bearing his reproach.

title: Sources of Sorrow—Persecution
poem:
Man may trouble and distress me,
'Twill but drive me to thy breast;
Life with trials hard may press me,
Heaven will bring me sweeter rest.
bible_verse: Though I walk in the midst of trouble, thou wilt revive me: thou shalt stretch forth thine hand against the wrath of mine enemies, and thy right hand shall save me.

title: Sources of Sorrow—Earthly Losses and Bereavements
poem:
Oh! blessed be the hand that gave;
Still blessed when it takes:
Blessed be he who smites to save,
Who heals the heart he breaks:
Perfect and true are all his ways
Whom heaven adores, and earth obeys.
bible_verse: Naked came I out of my mother's womb, and naked shall I return thither: the Lord gave and the Lord hath taken away; blessed be the name of the Lord.

title: Sources of Sorrow—the Sins of Others
poem:
I sorrow for the mental night
In which mankind around me lie;
Almighty Father, by thy might,
Arouse them from their lethargy.
bible_verse: Rivers of water run down mine eyes, because they keep not thy law.

title: Sources of Sorrow—the Number of the Wicked
poem:
Strait is the way, the door is strait,
Which lead to joys on high:
'Tis but a few that find the gate,
While crowds mistake, and die.
bible_verse: Broad is the way, that leadeth to destruction, and many there be which go in thereat: because strait is the gate, and narrow is the way, which leadeth unto life, and few there be that find it.

title: Sorrow Chosen Rather than Sin
poem:
It is not for me to be seeking my bliss,
And building my hopes in a region like this.
I look for a city which hands have not piled;
I pant for a country by sin undefiled.
bible_verse: Moses, when he was come to years, refused to be called the son of Pharaoh's daughter; choosing rather to suffer affliction with the people of God, than to enjoy the pleasures of sin for a season.

title: Believer's Confidence in Trouble
poem:
Although my wealth and comfort's lost,
My blooming hopes cut off I see,
Yet will I in my Saviour trust,
Whose matchless grace can reach to me.
bible_verse: Although the fig tree shall not blossom, neither shall fruit be in the vines; the labour of the olive shall fail, and the fields shall yield no meat; the flock shall be cut off from the fold, and there shall be no herd in the stalls: yet I will rejoice in the Lord, I will joy in the God of my salvation.

title: Believer's Comfort in Trouble
poem:
Thus trusting in thy word, I tread
The narrow path of duty on;
What though some cherished joys are fled?
What though some flattering dreams are gone?
Yet purer, brighter joys remain:
Why should my spirit then complain?
bible_verse: This is my comfort in my affliction: for thy word hath quickened me.

title: Christ an Example to the Afflicted
poem:
Our glorious Leader claims our praise
For his own pattern given,
While the long cloud of witnesses
Show the same path to heaven.
bible_verse: Even hereunto were ye called: because Christ also suffered for us, leaving us an example, that ye should follow his steps.

title: The Patriarchs Examples to the Afflicted
poem:
Once they were mourning here below,
And wet their couch with tears;
They wrestled hard, as we do now,
With sins, and doubts, and fears.
bible_verse: Wherefore seeing we also are compassed about with so great a cloud of witnesses, let us lay aside every weight, and the sin which doth so easily beset us, and let us run with patience the race that is set before us.

title: The Prophets Examples to the Afflicted
poem:
And shall not we aspire,
Like them our course to run?
The crown if we would wear,
The cross must first be borne.
Divinely taught, they showed the way,
First to believe, and then obey.
bible_verse: Take, my brethren, the prophets, who have spoken in the name of the Lord, for an example of suffering affliction, and of patience.

title: Benefits of Affliction—Self-abasement
bible_verse: Surely after that I was instructed, I smote upon my thigh. I was ashamed, yea, even confounded, because I did bear the reproach of my youth.

title: Benefits of Affliction—Contrition for Sin
poem:
What though afflictions pierced my heart!
I bless the hand that caused the smart;
It taught my tears awhile to flow,
But saved me from eternal woe.
bible_verse: I will go and return to my place, till they acknowledge their offence, and seek my face: in their affliction they will seek me early.

title: Benefits of Affliction—Patience
poem:
Through waves, and clouds, and storms,
He gently clears thy way:
Wait thou his time—the darkest night
Shall end in brightest day.
bible_verse: The trying of your faith worketh patience. But let patience have her perfect work, that ye may be perfect and entire, wanting nothing.

title: Benefits of Affliction—Humility
poem:
To the heart truly humbled by woe,
The anointing of joy shall be given;
To the tears that from penitence flow,
Shall he given a foretaste of heaven.
bible_verse: If I be wicked, woe unto me; and if I be righteous, yet will I not lift up mine head. I am full of confusion; therefore see thou mine affliction.

title: Benefits of Affliction—Submission
poem:
Take all, great God, I will not grieve,
But still will wish that I had still to give:
I hear thy voice, thou bidd'st me quit
My paradise; I bless, and do submit;
I will not murmur at thy word,
Nor beg thy angel to sheathe up his sword.
bible_verse: I was dumb, I opened not my mouth; because thou didst it.

title: Benefits of Affliction—Hope
poem:
The gloomiest day hath gleams of light,
The darkest wave hath bright foam near it;
And twinkles through the cloudiest night
Some solitary star to cheer it.
bible_verse: Why art thou cast down, O my soul? and why art thou disquieted in me? hope thou in God: for I shall yet praise him for the help of his countenance.

title: Benefits of Affliction—Holiness
poem:
Our hearts are fastened to this world
By strong and endless ties;
But every sorrow cuts a string,
And urges us to rise.
bible_verse: Now no chastening for the present seemeth to he joyous, but grievous: nevertheless, afterward it yieldeth the peaceable fruit of righteousness unto them which are exercised thereby.

title: Benefits of Affliction—Tries Our Sincerity
poem:
Though sorrows rise, and dangers roll
In waves of darkness o'er my soul;
Though friends are false, and love decays,
And few and evil are my days—
Yet even in nature's utmost ill,
I love thee, Lord! I love thee still.
bible_verse: He knoweth the way that I take: when he hath tried me, I shall come forth as gold.

title: Benefits of Affliction—Brings Sin to Remembrance
poem:
My former hopes are fled,
My terror now begins;
I feel, alas! that I am dead
In trespasses and sins.
bible_verse: If they be bound in fetters, and be holden in cords of affliction; then he showeth them their work, and their transgressions that they have exceeded.

title: Benefits of Affliction—Leads to Prayer
poem:
Ah! whither could we flee for aid
When tempted, desolate, dismayed;
Or how the hosts of hell defeat,
Had suffering saints no mercy-seat?
bible_verse: Oh remember not against us former iniquities: let thy tender mercies speedily prevent us: for we are brought very low.

title: Benefits of Affliction—Brings Us Back to God
poem:
Long unafflicted, undismayed,
In pleasure's path secure I strayed:
Thou madest me feel thy chastening rod,
And strait I turned unto my God.
bible_verse: I will hedge up thy way with thorns, and make a wall, that she shall not find her paths.—Then shall she say, I will go and return to my first husband; for then was it better with me than now.

title: Benefits of Affliction—Exercises Our Faith
poem:
Dark are the ways of providence,
While those who love thee groan;
Thy reasons lie concealed from sense,
Mysterious and unknown.
bible_verse: Ye are in heaviness through manifold temptations: that the trial of your faith, being much more precious than of gold that perisheth, though it be tried with fire, might be found unto praise and honour and glory at the appearing of Jesus Christ.

title: Benefits of Affliction—Teaches Our Frailties
poem:
